alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Guadalupe County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 8:59PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL ROOSEVELT, EASTERN DE BACA AND SOUTHEASTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM MDT... At 859 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sumner Lake, or 11 miles west of Fort Sumner, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Sumner, Sumner Lake State Park and Sumner Lake. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 308 and 341. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: De Baca County; Guadalupe County; Roosevelt County
